intro: Lotononis oligocephala, commonly known as the narrow-headed lotonon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with a distinct central disc. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
